alert.note: Alert for Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 4:23PM EST until January 03 at 11:52PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Lewis and Mason. In Ohio, Adams and Brown. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 PM EST, local law enforcement reported minor flooding in Lingering high water on some area roadways. . Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Maysville, Washington, West Union, Manchester, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Lewisburg, Tollesboro, Rome, Concord, Ribolt, Herron Hill, Trinity, Rectorville, Epworth, Orangeburg, Glen Springs, Bradysville and Charters.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
